thread.title: World Superbikes: Rea starts title defence with victory - BBC Sport
thread.title_full: World Superbikes: Rea starts title defence with victory - BBC Sport

title: World Superbikes: Rea starts title defence with victory - BBC Sport
text:
Read more about sharing. Jonathan Rea leads the field during Saturday's first race in Australia Defending world champion Jonathan Rea has won the opening race of the 2017 Superbike World Championship race at Phillip Island. 
The Northern Irishman edged ahead of Welsh rival Chaz Davies on the last of the 22 laps to clinch his third successive win in Australia. 
Rea's British and Kawasaki teammate, Englishman Tom Sykes, was third. 
"`It was a little bit like a bicycle race and no one wanted to put their nose in front," said Rea. 
The champion's victory - his 39th in WSB - ended Davies' six-race winning streak from 2016. 
There will be a second Superbike race Sunday at Phillip Island. Share this page
